definition: to use one's mouth (to say sth)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
a gentleman uses his mouth and not his fist
pinyin: jun1 zi3 dong4 kou3 bu4 dong4 shou3

sentences.english: It's my position that gentlemen should reason thing out rather than resort to force.
sentences.chinese: 我主张君子动口不动手。

sentences.english: Style is a way to say who you are without having to speak.
sentences.chinese: 你的风格让你无需动口，就说明了你是谁。

sentences.english: He was three years older than me, and better at both.
sentences.chinese: 他比我大三岁，动手动口都比我擅长。

sentences.english: In the arts field, "The gentleman uses his tongue but not his fists" isn't right absolutely.
sentences.chinese: 在艺术的领域里，“君子动口不动手”绝对是错误的。
